common.filter.object.description: Filter the result according to a set of criteria.

common.range.object.description: Limit the number of output. For a range of [a, n], the output will contain n elements, starting from the ath matching result.

common.sort.object.description: Specify the sorting of the returned result.

policyid.description: User defined local in policy ID.
User defined local in policy ID.

params.cdb.get.obj.option.opts.description:
Set fetch option for the request. If no option is specified, by default the attributes of the object will be returned.
object member - Return a list of object members along with other attributes.
chksum - Return the check-sum value instead of attributes.

params.cdb.get.table.option.opts.description:
Set fetch option for the request. If no option is specified, by default the attributes of the objects will be returned.
count - Return the number of matching entries instead of the actual entry data.
object member - Return a list of object members along with other attributes.
datasrc - Return all objects that can be referenced by an attribute. Require attr parameter.
get reserved - Also return reserved objects in the result.
syntax - Return the attribute syntax of a table or an object, instead of the actual entry data. All filter parameters will be ignored.

dstaddr.description: Destination address name from available addresses.

interface.description: Incoming interface name from available interfaces.

srcaddr.description: Source address name from available addresses.

action.description: Action taken when the threshold is reached.

quarantine-expiry.description: Duration of quarantine, from 1 minute to 364 days, 23 hours, and 59 minutes from now. (format: ###d##h##m, default = 5m). Requires quarantine set to attacker.

status.description: Enable/disable the active status of this anomaly sensor.

threshold.description: Number of detected instances per minute which triggers action (1 - 2147483647, default = 1000). Note that each anomaly has a different threshold value assigned to it.

interface.description: Incoming interface name from available interfaces.

threshold.description: Number of detected instances per minute which triggers action (1 - 2147483647, default = 1000). Note that each anomaly has a different threshold value assigned to it.

dst-addr.description: Destination address name from available addresses.

dstintf.description: Destination interface name from available interfaces.

nat-ippool.description: Name of the IP pools to be used to translate addresses from available IP Pools.

nat-port.description: Translated port or port range (0 to 65535).

protocol.description: Integer value for the protocol type (0 - 255).

srcintf.description: Source interface name from available interfaces.

status.description: Enable/disable the active status of this policy.

dstaddr.description: Address object to limit traffic monitoring to network traffic sent to the specified address or range.

interface.description: Monitored interface name from available interfaces.

logtraffic.description: Logging type to be used in this policy (Options: all | utm | disable, Default: utm).

scan-botnet-connections.description: Enable/disable scanning for connections to Botnet servers.

dstaddr6.description: IPv6 address object to limit traffic monitoring to network traffic sent to the specified address or range.

interface.description: Monitored interface name from available interfaces.

logtraffic.description: Logging type to be used in this policy (Options: all | utm | disable, Default: utm).

scan-botnet-connections.description: Enable/disable scanning for connections to Botnet servers.

srcaddr6.description: IPv6 address object to limit traffic monitoring to network traffic sent from the specified address or range.

action.description: Action performed on traffic matching the policy (default = deny).

dstaddr.description: Destination address object from available options.

ha-mgmt-intf-only.description: Enable/disable dedicating the HA management interface only for local-in policy.

intf.description: Incoming interface name from available options.

policyid.description: User defined local in policy ID.

srcaddr.description: Source address object from available options.

intf.description: Incoming interface name from available options.

policyid.description: User defined local in policy ID.

service.description: Service object from available options. Separate names with a space.

srcaddr.description: Source address object from available options.

action.description: Accept or deny traffic matching the policy.

auto-asic-offload.description: Enable/disable offloading policy traffic for hardware acceleration.

dnat.description: IPv4 DNAT address used for multicast destination addresses.

end-port.description: Integer value for ending TCP/UDP/SCTP destination port in range (1 - 65535, default = 1).

logtraffic.description: Enable/disable logging traffic accepted by this policy.

protocol.description: Integer value for the protocol type as defined by IANA (0 - 255, default = 0).

snat.description: Enable/disable substitution of the outgoing interface IP address for the original source IP address (called source NAT or SNAT).

snat-ip.description: IPv4 address to be used as the source address for NATed traffic.

start-port.description: Integer value for starting TCP/UDP/SCTP destination port in range (1 - 65535, default = 1).

action.description: Accept or deny traffic matching the policy.

auto-asic-offload.description: Enable/disable offloading policy traffic for hardware acceleration.

end-port.description: Integer value for ending TCP/UDP/SCTP destination port in range (1 - 65535, default = 65535).

protocol.description: Integer value for the protocol type as defined by IANA (0 - 255, default = 0).

start-port.description: Integer value for starting TCP/UDP/SCTP destination port in range (1 - 65535, default = 1).

application-list.description: Name of an existing Application list.

auth-cert.description: HTTPS server certificate for policy authentication.

auth-redirect-addr.description: HTTP-to-HTTPS redirect address for firewall authentication.

auto-asic-offload.description: Enable/disable offloading security profile processing to CP processors.

av-profile.description: Name of an existing Antivirus profile.

captive-portal-exempt.description: Enable to exempt some users from the captive portal.

custom-log-fields.description: Custom fields to append to log messages for this policy.

delay-tcp-npu-session.description: Enable TCP NPU session delay to guarantee packet order of 3-way handshake.

devices.description: Names of devices or device groups that can be matched by the policy.

diffserv-forward.description: Enable to change packet's DiffServ values to the specified diffservcode-forward value.

diffserv-reverse.description: Enable to change packet's reverse (reply) DiffServ values to the specified diffservcode-rev value.

diffservcode-forward.description: Change packet's DiffServ to this value.

diffservcode-rev.description: Change packet's reverse (reply) DiffServ to this value.

dlp-sensor.description: Name of an existing DLP sensor.

dnsfilter-profile.description: Name of an existing DNS filter profile.

dsri.description: Enable DSRI to ignore HTTP server responses.

dstaddr.description: Destination address and address group names.

dstaddr-negate.description: When enabled dstaddr specifies what the destination address must NOT be.

firewall-session-dirty.description: How to handle sessions if the configuration of this firewall policy changes.

fixedport.description: Enable to prevent source NAT from changing a session's source port.

fsso-agent-for-ntlm.description: FSSO agent to use for NTLM authentication.

global-label.description: Label for the policy that appears when the GUI is in Global View mode.

groups.description: Names of user groups that can authenticate with this policy.

icap-profile.description: Name of an existing ICAP profile.

inbound.description: Policy-based IPsec VPN: only traffic from the remote network can initiate a VPN.

internet-service.description: Enable/disable use of Internet Services for this policy. If enabled, destination address and service are not used.

internet-service-negate.description: When enabled internet-service specifies what the service must NOT be.

ippool.description: Enable to use IP Pools for source NAT.

ips-sensor.description: Name of an existing IPS sensor.

label.description: Label for the policy that appears when the GUI is in Section View mode.

learning-mode.description: Enable to allow everything, but log all of the meaningful data for security information gathering. A learning report will be generated.

logtraffic.description: Enable or disable logging. Log all sessions or security profile sessions.

logtraffic-start.description: Record logs when a session starts and ends.

match-vip.description: Enable to match packets that have had their destination addresses changed by a VIP.

mms-profile.description: Name of an existing MMS profile.

natinbound.description: Policy-based IPsec VPN: apply destination NAT to inbound traffic.

natip.description: Policy-based IPsec VPN: source NAT IP address for outgoing traffic.

natoutbound.description: Policy-based IPsec VPN: apply source NAT to outbound traffic.

outbound.description: Policy-based IPsec VPN: only traffic from the internal network can initiate a VPN.

permit-any-host.description: Accept UDP packets from any host.

permit-stun-host.description: Accept UDP packets from any Session Traversal Utilities for NAT (STUN) host.

profile-protocol-options.description: Name of an existing Protocol options profile.

profile-type.description: Determine whether the firewall policy allows security profile groups or single profiles only.

radius-mac-auth-bypass.description: Enable MAC authentication bypass. The bypassed MAC address must be received from RADIUS server.

redirect-url.description: URL users are directed to after seeing and accepting the disclaimer or authenticating.

replacemsg-override-group.description: Override the default replacement message group for this policy.

rtp-addr.description: Address names if this is an RTP NAT policy.

scan-botnet-connections.description: Block or monitor connections to Botnet servers or disable Botnet scanning.

schedule-timeout.description: Enable to force current sessions to end when the schedule object times out. Disable allows them to end from inactivity.

send-deny-packet.description: Enable to send a reply when a session is denied or blocked by a firewall policy.

service-negate.description: When enabled service specifies what the service must NOT be.

session-ttl.description: Session TTL in seconds for sessions accepted by this policy. 0 means use the system default session TTL.

spamfilter-profile.description: Name of an existing Spam filter profile.

srcaddr.description: Source address and address group names.

srcaddr-negate.description: When enabled srcaddr specifies what the source address must NOT be.

ssl-mirror.description: Enable to copy decrypted SSL traffic to a FortiGate interface (called SSL mirroring).

ssl-ssh-profile.description: Name of an existing SSL SSH profile.

tags.description: Names of object-tags applied to this policy.

tcp-session-without-syn.description: Enable/disable creation of TCP session without SYN flag.

timeout-send-rst.description: Enable/disable sending RST packets when TCP sessions expire.

users.description: Names of individual users that can authenticate with this policy.

utm-status.description: Enable to add one or more security profiles (AV, IPS, etc.) to the firewall policy.

uuid.description: Universally Unique Identifier (UUID; automatically assigned but can be manually reset).

vlan-cos-rev.description: VLAN reverse direction user priority: 255 passthrough, 0 lowest, 7 highest..

app-category.description: IDs of one or more application categories that this shaper applies application control traffic shaping to.

application.description: IDs of one or more applications that this shaper applies application control traffic shaping to.

dstaddr.description: IPv4 destination address and address group names.

dstaddr6.description: IPv6 destination address and address group names.

groups.description: Apply this traffic shaping policy to user groups that have authenticated with the FortiGate.

ip-version.description: Apply this traffic shaping policy to IPv4 or IPv6 traffic.

per-ip-shaper.description: Per-IP traffic shaper to apply with this policy.

srcaddr.description: IPv4 source address and address group names.

srcaddr6.description: IPv6 source address and address group names.

traffic-shaper.description: Traffic shaper to apply to traffic forwarded by the firewall policy.

traffic-shaper-reverse.description: Traffic shaper to apply to response traffic received by the firewall policy.

url-category.description: IDs of one or more FortiGuard Web Filtering categories that this shaper applies traffic shaping to.

users.description: Apply this traffic shaping policy to individual users that have authenticated with the FortiGate.

adom_rev_comment.description: The comment for the new ADOM revision. It will be ignored in add request if adom_rev_name is not set.

adom_rev_name.description: The name for the new ADOM revision. If not set in add request, no ADOM revision will be created during installation.

datetime.description:
Indicates the date and time of the schedule.
It should follow the following format: "YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm".
The value of this attribute should not be earlier than the current time of the system.

dev_rev_comment.description: The comment for the device configuration revision that will be generated during install.

attr.description: The name of the attribute to retrieve its datasource. Only used with <i>datasrc</i> option.

fields.description: Limit the output by returning only the attributes specified in the string array. If none specified, all attributes will be returned.

loadsub.description: Enable or disable the return of any sub-objects. If not specified, the default is to return all sub-objects.
